intro: Thamnochortus maximus, commonly known as the giant rock dandelion, is a striking plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and robust, hairy stems that often grow in rocky or sandy soils. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant adaptations. Thamnochortus maximus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and mountain slopes, where it thrives in full sun.
